intro: Leptadenia clavipes, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and has been used traditionally in some regions for medicinal purposes. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Its unique morphology and chemical composition make it an interesting subject for botanical and pharmacological studies.
